intro: Pedilonum brinchangense, commonly known as the Bornean sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the rich, moist soils of tropical rainforests.
